frontmatter.title: Internet of Things (IoT)
frontmatter.description: Data visualization plays vital roles in data science experiments and machine learning processes. Exploratory and explanatory data visualization helps us to create the thinking system, work on modeling the problem, construct a hypothesis, deliver insights, and more.

frontmatter.title: Data Visualization
frontmatter.description: Data visualization plays vital roles in data science experiments and machine learning processes. Exploratory and explanatory data visualization helps us to create the thinking system, work on modeling the problem, construct a hypothesis, deliver insights, and more.

frontmatter.title: AVISA Platform
frontmatter.description: Experimentation is a key element of Machine Learning Development. Differently, from most Software Development disciplines, Machine Learning relies on Intuition - Validation rather than on empiric tests to assess the behavior of a specific model.

frontmatter.title: On-Device AI
frontmatter.description: Smart applications are those applications that incorporate data-driven, actionable insights into the user experience. The interface of smart applications is not limited to device screens, but we can leverage the camera, microphone, and others for computer-human interactions; an example is smart home speakers.

frontmatter.title: Streaming Data
frontmatter.description: Machine learning shines at identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data. Lately, deep learning advances in new areas which most people know as media such as text, images, and sound. Here is a list of sample use cases, joined with the divisions to which they concern.

frontmatter.title: Deep Learning
frontmatter.description: From the perspective of data analysis, streaming data is the big data coming continuously from various sources such as nature, human, and machines, that we can process in real-time. The temperature of an environment, financial transactions, and state of a running program are examples of streaming data.

frontmatter.title: Natural Language Processing
frontmatter.description: Machine learning is the science of getting computers to act without being explicitly programmed. In the past decade, machine learning has given us self-driving cars, practical speech recognition, effective web search, and a vastly improved understanding of the human genome. Machine learning is so pervasive today that you probably use it dozens of times a day without knowing it. Many researchers also think it is the best way to make progress towards human-level AI.

frontmatter.title: Creative Intelligence
frontmatter.description: Creativity may be the ultimate moonshot for artificial intelligence. Already AI has helped write pop ballads, mimicked the styles of great painters and informed creative decisions in filmmaking. Experts wonder, however, how far AI can or should go in the creative process?
